Sentencas: High temperature alloys are being investigated for use in cathode air pre-heater for solid oxide fuel cell systems because of their high thermal conductivity, formability, manufacturability, and superior mechanical properties.
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters

Sentencas: However, it is well-known that high temperature alloys often contain a high concentration of Cr which presents a risk of evaporation and contaminating the cathode of the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters

Sentencas: The oxidation and Cr2O3 evaporation mechanisms of the alloys including alloy 625, SS309, and alloy 318 have been investigated by varying temperatures and water content of the exposure atmosphere.
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters

Sentencas: For the influence of water content, the alloys were isothermally exposed at 850 degrees C in dry air and air containing 1%, 3% and 9% of H2O at a high flow rate for 168 h. For the influence of temperature, the alloys were isothermally exposed at 650 degrees C, 750 degrees C and 850 degrees C in a 6.0 L/min air stream containing 3% H2O for 168 h.
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters

Sentencas: The results of this study show that Cr2O3 evaporation and oxidation rates were dramatically reduced with decreasing temperatures for alloy 625 and SS309.
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters

Sentencas: Alloy 318 exhibited a decreased oxidation rate with decreasing temperature, but it demonstrated a reverse trend to the temperature-dependent Cr2O3 evaporation compared to alloy 625 and SS309.
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters

Sentencas: The major effect of water vapour on the three tested materials appeared to be the further enhancement of Cr2O3 evaporation.
Titulo: Effect of Temperature and Water Content on the Oxidation Behaviour and Cr Evaporation of High-Cr Alloys for SOFC Cathode Air Preheaters
